etymology.interpretation: 糸(糸) (sī, 'silk') visually represents intertwined threads or fibers, emphasizing the appearance of silk strands.

examples.chinese: 糸是纺织品的基础材料(絲是紡織品的基礎材料)。
examples.pinyin: sī shì fǎngzhīpǐn de jīchǔ cáiliào.
examples.english: Silk is the basic material for textiles.

examples.chinese: 古代人用糸制作华丽衣裳(古代人用絲製作華麗衣裳)，象征着身份和地位(象徵著身份和地位)。
examples.pinyin: gǔdài rén yòng sī zhìzuò huálì yīshang, xiàngzhēng zhe shēnfèn hé dìwèi.
examples.english: Ancient people used silk to make gorgeous clothes, symbolizing status and rank.

examples.chinese: 古代的衣物多使用糸织造(古代的衣物多使用絲織造)，展现工匠的技艺(展現工匠的技藝)。
examples.pinyin: gǔdài de yīwù duō shǐyòng sī zhīzào, zhǎnxiàn gōngjiàng de jìyì.
examples.english: Ancient clothing was mostly woven with silk, showcasing exquisite craftsmanship.
